comments:
Default OneToMany annotation which is generated has no target set and NPE is thrown. If I add explicit @OneToMany annotation to EReference, model is processed without errors. This can be reproduced with attached ecore. If annotation on Database.model reference is removed, NPE is thrown .

This is #172645 resurfaced with better title.

Stack trace:

This was a bug, your eclasses have an entity annotation without a name attribute. This is now covered (in cvs). Will be in the next release.

Note that the entity annotation is not mandatory. As a default Teneo will add the entity annotation to all eclasses. This behavior can be controlled by an option.

gr. Martin
Works fine now, thanks. Entity annotation is used to persist only subset of classes in package(s).
